snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones': George R.R. Martin on that controversial scene
snippet.description:
* "Game of Thrones" has never strictly followed the book series it's based on, but that fan frustration turned disturbing on Sunday's episode.

snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones': Ratings record, renewed through season 6
snippet.description:
* Is "Game of Thrones" our new "Sopranos"? After season four debuted on Sunday, HBO revealed that the episode was watched by more people than the 2007 series finale of its landmark TV show. Sunday's return brought 6.6 million to the fantasy series during...
http://marquee.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/08/game-of-thrones-sets-ratings-record/

snippet.title: Is 'Game of Thrones' still as sharp?
snippet.description:
* HBO's deadly "Game of Thrones" returned Sunday night with one ominous rallying cry -- "All men must die" -- and few disappointments.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/07/showbiz/tv/game-of-thrones-season-4-premiere/index.html

snippet.title: 'Game of Thrones' author George R.R. Martin: Why he wrote The Red Wedding
snippet.description:
* Millions of "Game of Thrones" fans are feeling sadness, outrage, and, sure, some perverse excitement after watching Sunday's episode titled "The Rains of Castamere." But for Game of Thrones author George R.R. Martin, such reactions to "The Red Wedding" are nothing new. Martin has been receiving exclamatory emails about the disastrous Tully-Frey uni...
http://www.cnn.com/2013/06/07/showbiz/tv/game-martin-red-wedding-ew/index.html

snippet.title: Fantasy fans ready to 'Dance with Dragons'
snippet.description:
* It may be early July but "winter is coming." In fact, winter finally arrives this week for fans of George R.R. Martin's epic fantasy series "A Song of Ice & Fire." Following a six-year wait, the fifth and latest book, "A Dance with Dragons," hits stores Tuesday.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/LIVING/07/10/martin.dance.dragons/index.html

snippet.title: New 'Song of Ice and Fire' publication date set
Author George R.R. Martin's fantastic kingdoms
snippet.description:
* If George R.R. Martin's three-books-and-counting fantasy series "A Song of Ice and Fire" were made into a movie -- well, OK, at least a 10-hour miniseries -- it would require a director on the order of D.W. Griffith or Cecil B. DeMille. For the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros are indeed made up of a cast of thousands.
http://www.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/books/04/11/george.rr.martin/index.html

snippet.title: After the 'Red Wedding': 'Game of Thrones' promises more surprises, blood
snippet.description:
* If you thought the Red Wedding was rough, "Game of Thrones" promises more blood and brutality when it returns to HBO for its fourth season on Sunday night (April 6).
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/04/showbiz/game-of-thrones-season-four-preview/index.html
